Description: Momies d'Ibis, one of two studies for Plate 99 of the artist's 'Voyage dans la Basse et la Haute Egypte, pendant les campagnes du Général Bonaparte', 1802; row of mummies propped up against a wall, one unwrapped to reveal a skeleton Pen and grey ink, with watercolour
Producer name: Drawn by: Baron Dominique Vivant Denon
Curator's comments: Engraved by Pierre Philippe Choffard. There is no copy of Denon's 'Voyage...' in the Department. The B.L. copy is at 458.h.12. The minutes of the Trustees' meeting on 12th December, 1835, record that "two or three" of the drawings were missing when the group was offered to the Museum.
Exhibition history: 1999/2000 Oct-Jan Paris, Musée du Louvre, Denon 1747-1825
Associated names: Associated with: Napoléon I, Emperor of the French (Napoleon)
Illustration to: Baron Dominique Vivant Denon
Associated titles: Voyage dans la Basse et la Haute Egypte
